IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To preserve and protect the Hudson River, its tributaries, and related bodies of water. As an organization, Clearwater works to provide innovative environmental education programs, advocacy, and celebrations designed to expand peoples experience, awareness, and stewardship of this magnificent natural resource.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To preserve and protect the Hudson River, its tributaries, and related bodies of water. As an organization, Clearwater works to provide innovative environmental education programs, advocacy, and celebrations designed to expand peoples experience, awareness, and stewardship of this magnificent natural resource.
IRS990.Desc: sloop & education - activities: the sloop clearwater, "america's environmental flagship" for more than 54 years, serves as a floating classoom for children and adults, offering experiential and practical lessons about the history, science, ecology and social issues involved in the cleanup and preservation of the hudson river, as wel as programs in environmental leadership. in addition, the physical vessel itself serves as a teaching tool in the maritime arts. volunteers: volunteers help staff the sloop and teach at learning stations during sailing season.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: environmental action - activities: the organization activates individuals of all ages to become stewads of the environment and to lead within their own communities through direct research and citizen involvment in water quality and environmental concerns.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: community outreach - The organization inspires individuals and communities to help preserve and protect the Hudson River through community events and music. Volunteers are also engaged to help manage and run the events and to help educate the general public.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the membership of the corporation shall consist of persons who are interested in advancing the purpose of the corporation and who pay minimum annual dues, as set from time to time by the board of directors. the membership shall control the corporation through the annual election of directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the membership shall control the corporation through the annual election of directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b: Describe Decisions of Governing Body Approval by Members or Shareholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: whenever the board of directors shall decide that a question submitted for its decision is of such importance that it should be submitted to a vote of the corporation, the board shall: submit to the secretary, in writing, such question, formatted and worded precisely as it is to be finally presented; direct the secretary to include such question on the regular ballot for comment or direction; or, if the board should order such a question to be included on the ballot for vote, the board should direct the secretary to distribute the ballot and canvass the vote in the same manner as for the annual election of directors. a majority vote of all ballots shall decide the question. the board shall upon the wrutten request of fifty members of the corporation submit ot vote any question that they propose. amendments to the by-laws may be proposed by petition of any five members of the board of directors or any fifty members of the corporation. if such an amendment is approved by the board, it shall be submitted to the corporation for a referendum vote. such a vote could take place at the same time as the election of the board, or at any other time set by the board, and in accordance with the procedures set forth ina rticle xi.if approved by two-thirds of those voting, such amendment will become part of these by-laws.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board will receive the 990 prior to filing but the vote to submit the 990 will be done by the Executive Committee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: board members are responsible for revising and updating disclosures annually or as new potential conflicts arise.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: a compensation committee which consists of different board members decides the compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: governing documents are made available on request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Decreases
Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Increases
Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Decreases

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WE HAD VOLUNTEERS SAIL ABOARD CLEARWATER.CLEARWATER'S VOLUNTEERS FILL WEEK-LONG SPOTS AND ASSIST WITH THREE MAINTASKS: EDUCATION, CLEANING, AND SAILING.WE ALSO HAVE VOLUNTEERS DURING THE YEAR DOING REGULAR OFFICE CLERICAL WORK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4D - ALL OTHER ACCOMPLISHMENT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS -"SAILING CLASSROOMX AND ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS SERVING CHILDRENAND ADULT PUBLIC AWARENESS -DISTRIBUTION OF RELEVANT RIVER WATER QUALITY INFORMATION
